message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Phe508 deletion on chromosome 7 is associated with cystic fibrosis, and meconium ileus is a common complication of cystic fibrosis in neonates. Congenital megacolon is associated with Hirschsprung disease, which is a separate genetic disorder. Cardiac defects and neural tube defects are not typically associated with cystic fibrosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The deletion of Phe508 on chromosome 7 indicates a diagnosis of cystic fibrosis. Meconium ileus is a common complication of cystic fibrosis in newborns. Congenital megacolon is associated with Hirschsprung disease, which can be a complication of cystic fibrosis but is not the most common complication. Cardiac defects and neural tube defects are not typically associated with cystic fibrosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. A deletion of Phe508 on chromosome 7 is associated with cystic fibrosis. Meconium ileus is a common complication of cystic fibrosis, caused by the thickening of secretions in the intestine. Congenital megacolon is associated with Hirschsprung disease, which is not related to cystic fibrosis. Cardiac defects and neural tube defects are not commonly associated with cystic fibrosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The deletion of Phe508 on chromosome 7 is associated with cystic fibrosis (CF), which can increase the risk of meconium ileus, a complication that occurs due to the thickening of the meconium (first stool) leading to intestinal obstruction. CF is not associated with congenital megacolon, cardiac defects, or neural tube defects.

Among the given options, meconium ileus is a common complication of cystic fibrosis in infants. Congenital megacolon is associated with Hirschsprung disease, which is a different genetic disorder. Cardiac defects and neural tube defects are not typically associated with cystic fibrosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The deletion of Phe508 on chromosome 7 is characteristic of cystic fibrosis. Meconium ileus is a complication commonly seen in infants with cystic fibrosis, where the thick, sticky meconium blocks the intestines. Congenital megacolon and neural tube defects are not typically associated with cystic fibrosis. Cardiac defects can occur in individuals with cystic fibrosis, but they are not the most common or specific complication.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The deletion of Phe508 on chromosome 7 is associated with cystic fibrosis, which can lead to meconium ileus in infants. Congenital megacolon is associated with Hirschsprung's disease, cardiac defects are not typically associated with cystic fibrosis, and neural tube defects are not associated with this genetic mutation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The deletion of Phe508 on chromosome 7 is associated with cystic fibrosis, which can lead to meconium ileus in newborns. Congenital megacolon (Hirschsprung disease) and neural tube defects are not associated with cystic fibrosis. While cardiac defects are a possible complication, meconium ileus is the most commonly associated complication with cystic fibrosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The deletion of Phe508 on chromosome 7 is associated with cystic fibrosis, which can lead to meconium ileus in newborns. Congenital megacolon (also known as Hirschsprung’s disease) is more commonly associated with defects in the enteric nervous system, while cardiac defects and neural tube defects are not typically associated with cystic fibrosis.
